results.title: The Transition tapes
results.brief_description: These tapes are intended to aid the Transition Education evaluation process by raising relevant questions and issues. They enable re-assessment of attitudes to learning and resources, employment and unemployment from five viewpoints : student, teacher, community, employer and school administrator. No other credits available.

results.title: Planning for school effectiveness: program budgeting
results.brief_description: Explains school-based program budgeting using detailed examples of the highly effective approach at Rosebery District High School, Tasmania. Considers policy making and planning community and staff involvement, management of conflict, building consensus, and evaluation. No other credits available.

results.title: Not Crippled, Not Useless
results.brief_description: Michael Briffa is fourteen and will probably be confined to a wheelchair for the rest of his life. This program explores Michael’s determination and success in being allowed to enrol in an ordinary school. As well, Michael’s parents discuss their attitudes to special schools.

results.title: Equal opportunity tapes
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Cockram and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Emphasises the importance of equal opportunity to both male and female teachers. Tape 1. Introduces and defines the concept of equal opportunity. 2. Designed to show what the real world is about for women. 3. Attempts to encourage teachers to examine, analyse and consider altering their classroom practice.

results.title: Different sort of system
results.brief_description: Looks at an alternative form of education at the Benedict Community school in New South Wales that is designed to meet the needs of school leavers who are unable to cope with the traditional school system. The course aims to encourage the development of the students as individuals and prepares them for their transition into the workforce.

results.title: Riverboat heritage
results.creator_credit: Brad Smart, Russell Hurley and Russell Hurley Film Productions
results.brief_description: Provides a comprehensive chronological history of the riverboats that travelled the major rivers, particularly the Murray. Portrays the transportation of supplies to inland farmers and goldseekers and the transportation of farm products to the markets of yesteryear. to the service of the tourist trade of today. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Amazing ants
results.brief_description: Explores life in an ant colony. Shows ants fending for and protecting themselves and milking a herd of aphids. Also reveals the intricate tunnels of an underground nest, food storage and the care of young larvae and pupae.

results.title: Kanga Cricket
results.brief_description: An Australian Cricket Board primary development programme for kids, sponsored by the Australian Diary Corporation and supported by the Commonwealth Department of Sport, Recreation and Tourism. Demonstrates the concept of Kanga cricket, a simplified adaptation of traditional cricket rules introduced into Australian schools. Former Australian cricket captain Kim Hughes and Peter Russell-Clarke participate.

results.title: Participation and equity program
results.brief_description: Outlines the philosophy behind the Participation and Equity Program and provides an overview of the ways in which some schools throughout Australia are implementing programs that are attempting to come to terms with overcoming barriers to effective participation by students in education. Changes in curriculum, school research community groups, and the teaching of English as a second language are just some of the methods outlined. No other credits.

results.title: The Voyage of the Pacific peacemaker
results.brief_description: An intriguing look at a group of people who set out from Australia to sail first of all to Muroroa Atoll in the Pacific and then to the west coast of the USA to protest against the French tests in the Pacific and the deployment of the Trident nuclear submarines. Raises issues about the effectiveness of such protests, the motivations of the people involved and the differences of opinion of the people in the group. Suitable for upper secondary level.
